column2: Bring out some bait and wait
Camp by an affected village with your horses
column3: Reste a la rendez-vous avec vos chevales.

column2: Let's observe the folk saying "Talk of tigers and they are sure to come".

You feel bad throwing away a whole lamb, but are sure the tiger will feel worse. You wait playing two rounds of Yunnori with Marshal [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] until you hear intense bleating from behind the thicket. The beast has returned. Rushing to your saddle and with the dogs disappearing you make a decision.
Try to lure the cat into the clear.
Charge!
column3: Allons-Y!

column2: Ride around the tiger.

Part of the company rides to the edge of the forest. You wait on your trained dogs to wear down the prey. Soon enough through the fog the Great White Hope appears on the edge of the new terrain. You ready your spears and safe in numbers surround the tiger. As you draw near, you see the tiger bristling with wrath as you spear it to death from all sides..
I dub you polecat.
column3: Votre nouveaux nom est Polechat

column2: Your company rides out to the forest edge. After a few minutes you hear confused yelps in the woods. It transpires the hunt is finished, the tiger is not anywhere near and two dogs need good help.
Mongrols!.

The trapped tiger looks a blurred black, white and red mess as the lance approaches. The point goes clean by her neck and is buried in the ground behind the body. You take the game back to the homestead.
Phew! Did it look as good as it felt?

Your horse bursts through the bushes. You trample a huntsdog by mistake, slowing down you notice your dogs scattering left and right. No amount of whistling brings the dogs closer as you suddenly see the tigeress has made a stop and has two cubs. You charge into the tiger but miss. The tiger jumps on you and your men quickly surround you.
His Magesty is dying out here!
column3: Son eminence est en travers de mort ici.

column2: Your horse bursts through the bushes and trips over a large exposed root. You hear a snap and are flung into half eaten lamb. While you curse the loss your men stream past you in pursuit of the Tiger.
Drats!.
column3: Zut!

column2: You set after the tiger at a furious pace. The tiger doesn't let but your party are enjoying the chase. After a hearty chase you circle around the animal in ever smaller circles toying with it. The big cat goes mad with indecision and utterly exhausted is bled to death by periodic sword swipes. You feel that it died inside before leaving its mortal coil.
The fur is mine.

You set after the tiger at a furious pace. The tiger doesn't let but your party are enjoying the chase. After a hearty chase you circle around the animal in ever smaller circles toying with it. The big cat goes mad with indecision and utterly exhausted is bled to death by periodic sword swipes. You feel that it died inside before leaving its mortal coil. Also two tiger cubs are found.
Besides my fur these will make nice gifts for a certain someone.
Spare the spares.
You camp outside a village after reassuring the village elder. The villagers are throwing a fete for a newly married couple, you and your men are keeping vigilence from a distance.
It would be shameful to give up
What a shame all these tender women.
This task is bogus.
Dig a tiger trap.
One by one the lanterns and laughs go out in the village. A coldness engulfs you and your men.
Let's go home before we get sick
Send some men to the village wall.
Set up the campfire and tents. The tiger isn't coming today.
You and a select few of your men go into the village and see a public dance is in procession. You assess the situation.
Pick the most fair maiden to dance with.
Drink baekju then join in the dance.
Accuse the elder of being the tiger
Head back to your men.

Your men head to the village wall. Suddenly you hear a call. You run over to see the fearful figure hunched over the village walls. It is the tiger with a goat dripping from its mouth. The hunt has begun!
After it!
Archers Fire!
Give me your bow.

Your men head to the village wall. Suddenly you hear a savage cry and a scream. You run over to see a tiger trying to drag a teeming soldier into the night. The remaining soldiers look stricken with fear at such demon.
Charge!
Archers Fire!
Let's get out of here!.

You creep out your tent and you see the tiger next to the fire. It is trying to hook the roast piglet off the stake. You grab a standard from the earth. The Tiger continues to tear at the roast pork, trying to knock it off. It knocks off the grease pot and the brown taste spills on the tiger.
Stab the tiger into the fire.
Realistically this won't work.
You are snuggled in your tent, warmed by your dogs, drifting to a well deserved rest when you hear a shuffling sound and a pot fall over.
It is nothing
It seems someone still uses piss pots.
I don't want to know what it is. Look how my dogs are all nervous.
It is the tiger coming to eat the remains of the roast. The fire is still alight. I will hatch a plan!
You dance far too elegantly for the folk music. However your partner seems to enjoy the status of being with a great Wang. You lean in and tell her.
Thank you for the dance.
How would you like to live the life of royalty?
Your father looks passed out. Lead me discreetly to your reside..

Breathlessly she replies yes and you tell her to meet you by the gates in an hour. You wait. She arrives flustered in a cloak too long for her and you escort her to your tent. The pair of you spend the night exchanging vows and making love. You wake up, stretch and wake her up.
It's time for you to go home.
I will find you a husband.
I make you a royal concubine.
She tells you that she is planning on becoming a Shaman and appologizes, she doesn't want to be seen with a man now that the spirits and air are her master.
Rats.
We are quite in need of a Shaman in the palace.

You breathe on her neck and she pushes you off. You sit down with your men and she signals you to follow her, which you do from a distance. She leads you to a small dwelling with pigs walking in and out the property. You grimince as you go inside and pray you don't get ill. You remove your clothing reluctantly and make tender affections to the maiden on the bedding.
What a tigeress.
Your archers line up and they shoot a volley at the slowing down tiger. The tiger runs off into the forest but is retrieved an hour later by aides following its trail of blood.
The fur is mine.
Hang up the tiger and sell its fur for the victim's families'.
The archers shoot a volley and only one clefts the Tigers ear off. Most landind in the light thicket. It turns around and dashes.
Drats!
Fire a hopeful shot.
Set up camp. We'll try again.
You had little hope but it transpired that the heavens wanted that arrow to pierce the skull and land in the Tiger's cognation. Your men hail you as a master archer.
All pluck, no luck.
Thank heavens
Your archers line up and they shoot a volley at the tiger climbing up. The tiger scrambles despite the weight of arrows and makes it to the top before taking its final rest.
The fur is mine.
Hang up the tiger and promise to sell the proceeds of its fur to the victim's families'.
The archers shoot a volley and only one clefts the Tigers ear off. Most pierce lanterns and are fixed on the wall. The tiger reaches the top.
Drats!
Fire a hopeful shot.
You had little hope but it seems that the heavens wanted that arrow to pierce the behind of the tiger and unravel its organs. Your men hail you as a master archer.
All pluck, no luck.
Thank heavens
Your men attack the tiger and it kills one misfortunate. Fortunately the beast is overwhelmed by vengeful spears.
Holy animal of the mountains my arse.
Pay for a memorial.
Your men surge in a wave and the tiger in an pale blur slays one misfortunate who carried a Dan-knife. Your men scatter leaving you alone with the tiger.
Fight.
Run away. I will leave you spirit of the mountains
You drink deep from the only metal cup in the village. You feel enabled to do anything.
Climb a building.
Dance with anyone
Accuse the elder of being the tiger
List the glorious deeds of your ancestors

You climb a stocky hut, built out of logs and brown paste. Fortunately it doesn't have a paper screen so it is stable. You see your unfun subjects urging you to come down. After a near fall that you swear was improbable you reach the top. Safe at the top you scan the area and spot a tiger climbing the palisade.
Tiger!.
Observe the tiger from a birds eye view.
Your men scramble to their feet and thanks to your drunken ingenuinity, shouted at your top voice, flank the tiger and spear it to death against the wall.
I should lead like this more often..

The tiger tries to circle around you. You grab an abandoned spear and stab at the tiger. The tiger bleeds crimson drops and howls. After retreating so you can hear your heartbeats, the beast makes an ill decided lunge as you thrust with both hands. The spear goes cleanly through its neck. You run but the work is done.
You men are cowards!
Reap the praise.

The tiger tries to circle around you. You grab a spear and stab at the tiger. The tiger bleeds crimson drops and growls. After retreating so you can hear your heartbeats, the beast makes lunge pushing your spear sideways. You scream as it's claws slice your body.
Help!

The tiger starts licking the fat off itself. You charge and stab the tiger who lets out a roar tumbling into the fire. It briefly looks like a normal tiger as the flames cover it and in it's pain it leaps into a tent. Your men come out in a disorganized mess and shorten the tiger's suffering.
But the fur is ruined!
Burning bright.
You wait for a better opportunity but your dogs start barking. The tiger senses the soldiers waking and bounds off into the night sending fat splattering on some tents.
I'm going to not tell anybody!
You wait a few days arguing with your Marshal [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] and come to realize one of you aren't cut out for tiger hunting.
And it isn't me!
You dance with a rather grithy lady.
The best kind!.
It is morning and you wake up pressed against the wall by flesh. You must reach your clothes before the public finds out.
Help! Bodyguards!
Lift her off you.
You dance with an elderly lady.
The best kind!.
The elder introduces you to her daughter. Or what you believe based on her long hair.
The best kind!

You awake slowly to the sounds of birds chirping. You are rustled and you see the face of an emotional girl. "Get out of my parents bed before my father comes home and kills us all." She hisses. You look to your left and see an elderly woman unclothed.
Please direct me to the door!.

You awake slowly to the sounds of birds chirping. Light enters the room and you see a young woman asleep. You dress quietly and remember the tiger. On entering the next room you see her father tied up sleepless while her mother is asleep on their futon. Marshal [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] is by the door looking unamused.
Please direct me to the door!.
You loudly accuse the elder of the village of being the tiger. You explain the more perverse aspects of his masterplan to a dwindling audience.
Get the troops. Send him to jail!
It is a figure of speech. The tiger is in all of us.
I'm getting an early night.

After digging a well concealed hole nothing of note happens for the rest of the day. You are waken up at four in the morning. [Root.job_marshal.GetTitledFirstName] says the tiger fell into your well disguised tiger trap this morning. She has been struggling to exit the earth.
Let me throw a spear to its miserable head.
Do you know the fable of the villager and tiger?

You observe the tiger make its way into the village and prowl into a henhouse. The commotion is silenced by the commemoration. You notice how satisifed it is as it makes its way up the ineffective palisade.
I will strive to be like the tiger!
You can be chicken and be eaten.
Suddenly on the perimeter. You hear a horn. The tiger is spot and riding closer you see its gastly form fearlessly approaching the village. What do you want to do?
Fill it with arrows.
Set the dogs on it. We can't run down this hill
After two weeks your soldiers return with the beast's fur. They claim they gave the meat to the starving villagers. The fur is luxurious and will make its impression on foreign dignitaries.
Great endevor men!
It was mine! Send these so called heroes to work in the mines.
column3: Quanzhen, the fulfilled virtue.
column4: Le Quanzhen, vertu remplies.

column2: Make a portrait of me killing the tiger. Frame it with jade.

Walking through your court one day you see [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] bent over a woodern table practicing caligraphy. You wait for a bow to your magnificance but in naught as [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] practices "Ka", the character for family, combining the pigs with the roof. Suddenly you are struck by the irony that your commoners who live with the pigs have no clue how to even form this symbol.
Let us make an experiment!
I love your style sonsengnim!
This had better result in something I can enjoy!

You gather some peasants, some levy soldiers and invite some city people to your estate. You present [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] with the heavy task of teaching them the heavenly radicals and to read. You will come back in a month to check on the progress.
I am a generous god.

It was a failure Wang-shi. You had almost forgotten about the experiment but on return [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] informed you everyone but one peasant had failed to learn the 200 common characters. This student had performed to [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName]'s expectations who wants to bring him back to the court.
Let them do the enterance exam.
An untouchable?!?!
A steady hand and handsome? Of course!

It was a failure Wang-shi. You had almost forgotten about the experiment but on return [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] informed you everyone but one peasant had failed to learn the 200 common characters. This student had performed to [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName]'s expectations who wants to bring her back to the court.
Let them do the enterance exam.
An untouchable?!?!
She's an untouchable. Only I get to touch her
You eagerly returned a day early to see a tale of two classes. The city students had learned roughly half of the characters
column3: the rice paddy fielders had learned barely forty on average. What [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] found striking was that many ignored the basic characters and focused on the radicals and complex characters. "I think it is because they are rebelious. What is your conclusion?"

column2: Proof bloodline purity makes for far smarter people.
We need to make an academy for the clever city folk.
The students didn't learn the characters they already had a word for. We should use an alphabet like the Japanese and seal all the foreign ideas to Han characters.
These foreign characters take too long to learn ...

You have recieved a suprise delegation from your leading nobles. Understanding you are determined to reform the language they suggest you only use your new script for grammatical principles (e.g. the, a, of).
There is a nervous atmosphere in the palace as your leading nobles demand an audience. You let them wait thirty seconds before they burst in and demand you put your script to the grave.

Your leading nobles have all decided to join you for a suprise barbeque. You listen to increasingly loud complaints, as you mix pork with soaked vegetables, if one thing is for sure they don't want to go back to school.

Your leading nobles have brought their private armies outside your palace for a discussion on linguistics. Being that Chinese and Korean are so different, does the [Root.GetTitle] intend to muddy Chinese classics with the new language? .
Limit the new alphabet to grammar
Promise the alphabet will be only used for native words.
I seem to have went too far. I will write an appology to the nobles.
You misunderstand me. I only intended to coin a handful of new chinese characters.
You have decided to reform the ancestrial language. After restless nights you have decided.
To select 30 Han characters and use them as letters.
To adapt Budhist scripts from the South Seas
To send a delegation into the steppies. Find out how they communicate
To create your own language

You choose 30 Han characters that your people have come to associate with certain sounds. You've drawn inspiration from past names of original dynasties. This reduces the amount of characters by at least 1000, you can already hear the praise of future students as you reflect.
This should work.
I should just give up.
You have summoned a Guru. For several weeks he teaches you the languages of india.
This is way out.
These innovations in writing could give us ways to express any consonant and vowel!
These new innovations could be coupled into syllable blocks to retain the structure of our Han vocabulary
This is the way out
You focus so much in learning the new alphabet that you notice you're in need of time to do other tasks. This experiment with regret should be closed.
At least I can now quote the Sutras in their purest form.
Delegate tasks I must persist!

After compromise and assistance from your Guru you fashion an alphabet that works. There is no need for memorising strange letter combinations like 'B-ae-k-j-e'. How it is said, it is written. For the first time you print the word for "Vision".
Announce to the people they have the right to write.

Consulting a growing staff you fashion an alphabet like you've never seen before. There is no need for memorising strange letter combinations like 'B-ae-k-j-e' as with the visible rules your people can write it in one or two letters if they wish. How it is said, it is written. For the first time you print the word for "Vision".
They could learn this alphabet in a week.
Oops I left out "f" and "v" sounds!.
Your delegation has returned. They went into deepest Mongolia, met with Nestorians and even met a Greek on their return trip. They thank you for the bribes for saving their lives.
Those Mongolian scripts look grand.
Do you think you could get the Christians to make us an alphabet?
What a waste of time.
Making an alphabet borders that fragile space between insanity and genius.
I'll create my own language.
Create a secret language.
The research began with a delegation south but quickly metamorphed into uncovering Christian missionary documents. These Nestorian letters seem really helpful to represent constanent sounds.
But would anyone use it.

The adoption of a fusion of Tartar, Baygal and Mongolian scripts is eased by the knowledge of your priestesses who choose the best features of the scripts. It will be written top to bottom and has a flowery cursive style. While our words in common only feature Kara, blackness, and Ool, cry, you feel a kinship to these peoples.

If the Gogoreyo decided to migrate west we would live in the endless plains. In fact if Koreans want to return to Manchuria they need to stop being so slavish to Han tendencies. The new alphabet is written right to left like many steppie scripts but it looks distinctly korean and uses many accent marks.
I'd rather be Khan than Han.
You plan to create a pink bow and arrow for sweet ___________. Teaching life skills is important to get her more worldly.
Right through the heart!
No! No! Let's Reconsider.
You finish your archery set and hail her while you are visiting a temple. You offer her the bow and arrows and she asks you for lessons
Life lessons!
You are visiting a Buddhist monk for some advice when you meet __________. He offers you a bow and arrows. But you don't know what to do with it!
Ask him for lessons!
It's not my style!
You finish your archery set and set off for the shrine she visits. By chance you meet her and offer her the completed set. She blinks and says it is not to her style
She is feisty!
I tire of this!
You Give her first lesson with your arms around her half the time. You stress breath control and encourage her to change her targets.
One week to go!
Heart pounding _________ gives you your first archery lesson. You feel secure on his stable chest as he helps aim the bow. You managed to hit the scarecrow off.
One week to go!
You Give her first lesson with your arms around her half the time. She seems uncomfortable and doesn't hit any of the targets.
It could've went worse!
This bores me!
You meet ______ for a lesson. She looks ravishing and you step back to have a look when she lets loose a shot. Hitting the gardener in the arm by mistake.
Physican!
I'll save you!
You didn't mean to hit the gardener by mistake.
So embarassing.
You didn't mean to hit the gardener by mistake. Fortunately ___________ galently pulled the arrow and wrapped up the bleeding. He made the gardener swear to secretcy
I need to repay him somehow.
It is reported that ___________ is teaching your daughter how to draw a bow and arrow. On my own perogative I've collected extracts from their conversations.
I'll made a bowing maid from you.
This sounds very practical. I've got to reward him..
Well if they are only going to draw.
She is going on house arrest!.
Your guards drag in _________ who pleads innocent and only wanted to serve the country.
Your going to jail!
You will be of service in the army!
You meet _______ for her lesson. She hits the first three but is looking distracted. You make your move.
I have a house nearby [From.GetMilordMilady] it has better targets than here.
I'm affirmed. Now I can end this.
You show _______ your house and where your target is. She responds to your charms and hours later you have both given a few tries.
I have a house nearby [From.GetMilordMilady] it has better targets that this inside.
I'm affirmed. Now I can end this.

You follow ____________ to a house he definately rented. You go inside and see it is rather scarce apart from a floor-bed. He whispers some words and you embrace and you fall on the covers, somewhat earlier than you would've liked, your time together ends.
Oh how I arched!.
It is that time of year for Chuseok! Besides the feast I have to arrange the visit to my ancestors graves and catch up with family. Close brothers and sisters might come too. This means gifts!
Anticipation.

Dear vassal,
I hereby invite you to attend my celebration of the feast of Chuseok.

Your Liege,
[From.GetFullName]

hiermit lade ich Euch ein, meiner Feier zum Chuseok beizuwohnen.

column4: Das werde ich mir merken…

column2: In the Korean autumn feasts, tradition dictates that you offer a gift to your spouse. You should plan for this and buy something before the feast begins.
column3: En Inde, lors des festins de l'automne, la tradition dit que vous devez offrir un cadeau à votre douce moitié. Faites preuve de prévoyance, achetez quelque chose avant le début du festin.
column4: Die Tradition verlangt, dass Ihr zum Herbstfest Eurem Ehepartner ein Geschenk macht. Ihr solltet dies planen und etwas kaufen, bevor das Fest beginnt.
column6: En el banquete Indio de otoño, es tradición que ofrezcas un regalo a tu esposa. Deberías planificarte y comprar algo antes de que comience el banquete.

column2: A jade necklace would be perfect!
column3: Un collier précieux, ce sera parfait !
column4: Ein juwelenverziertes Halsband wäre perfekt.
column6: ¡Un collar de joyas sería perfecto!

column2: Perhaps a small perfume box or something.
column3: Une petite boîte contenant du parfum, ce sera bien assez.
column4: Vielleicht ein wenig Parfum.
column6: Tal vez un pequeño perfume o algo así.

column2: She can do without gifts.
column3: Elle vivra bien sans cadeaux.
column4: Sie kann auch ohne auskommen.
column6: Puede pasar sin regalos.

column2: Let's go market for my lover...
column3: Je préfère dépenser cet argent pour ma maîtresse...
column4: Ich werde stattdessen meiner Geliebten Geld schenken.
column6: Mejor gastaré el dinero en mi amante...

column2: A magnificent steed would please him!
column3: Un magnifique cheval lui ferait plaisir !
column4: Ein großartiges Pferd wird ihm gefallen.
column6: ¡Un magnífico caballo le gustará!

column2: A unique patterned cape or something will be enough.
column3: Une belle cape, ce sera bien assez.
column4: Ein schöner Mantel wird genug sein.
column6: Una bonita capa o algo así bastará.

column2: No gifts for him.
column3: Il vivra bien sans cadeaux.
column4: Er kann auch ohne Geschenke auskommen.
column6: Puede pasar sin regalos.

column3: Je préfère dépenser cet argent pour mon amant...
column4: Ich werde stattdessen meinem Geliebten Geld schenken.
column6: Mejor gastaré el dinero en mi amante...

column2: Chuseok is about giving. You notice the merchants have all overpriced their goods into "sets". You plan to give a gift for your lover
column3: En accord avec la tradition, vous pouvez offrir un cadeau à votre amant ou à votre maîtresse lors du festin de l'automne.
column4: Traditionsgemäß könnt Ihr Eurer Liebschaft ein Geschenk zum Herbstfest machen.

column2: The castle is decorated with flowers and colorful tapestries, carpets and ribbons. All the guests have arrived, there is a bustle of people all eager and full of festive spirit. It's time for the feast to begin!
column3: Le château est décoré de fleurs, de tentures, de tapis et de rubans de toutes les couleurs. Tous les invités sont là. Quelle belle foule de gens joyeux et remplis d'un esprit festif ! C'est l'heure, que le festin commence !
column4: Die Burg ist mit Blumen und bunten Tapeten, Teppichen und Schleifen geschmückt. Alle Gäste sind angekommen, ein wahres Gewühl von Menschen voller Freude und Festgeist. Es ist Zeit, die Feier beginnen zu lassen!
column6: El castillo está decorado con flores, coloridos tapetes, alfombras y lazos. Los invitados han llegado, hay bullicio de gente impaciente y con espíritu festivo. ¡Es hora de que comience el banquete!

column2: Welcome, all!
column3: Soyez tous les bienvenus !
column4: Seid Willkommen!
column6: ¡Bienvenidos todos!

column2: Cheosok is over, but it was all to the highest standard. Your guests make their way home and you gaze over the balcony, pleased at how things turned out.
column3: Le festin est terminé. C'était fabuleux ! Alors que les invités rentrent chez eux, vous vous asseyez, un sourire aux lèvres. Les choses se sont très bien déroulées.
column4: Die Feier ist vorbei, es war ein fantastisches Fest. Als die Gäste aufbrechen, ruht Ihr Euch aus und lächelt, zufrieden mit dem Ausgang.
column6: El banquete ha terminado, pero fue fantástico. Mientras los invitados se marchan te sientas y te sonríes a ti mismo complacido de cómo han ido las cosas.

column2: I should do this again next year!
column3: Je ferai la même chose l'année prochaine !
column4: Ich sollte das nächstes Jahr erneut machen!
column6: ¡Debería repetirlo el año que viene!

column2: The Cheosok celebrations are over, but one incident stings. As the guests make their way home, you sit down and ponder what went wrong.
column3: Le festin est terminé, mais tout ne s'est pas déroulé comme prévu. Alors que les invités rentrent chez eux, vous passez en revue les incidents qui se sont produits.
column4: Die Feier ist vorbei, doch lief es nicht ganz wie gehofft. Als die Gäste aufbrechen, ruht Ihr Euch aus und grübelt, was wohl schief ging.
column6: El banquete ha terminado, pero no ha salido como esperabas. Mientras los invitados se marchan te sientas y te preguntas qué ha salido mal.

column2: Maybe next time it will be better.
column3: La prochaine fois sera peut-être meilleure.
column4: Vielleicht wird es nächstes Jahr besser.
column6: Puede que la próxima vez vaya mejor.

column2: The Cheosok is over, but it was a fantastic feast. As you make your way home, you think that you'd probably come back next year again if invited.
column3: Le festin est terminé. C'était fabuleux ! Alors que vous reprenez le chemin de la maison, vous pensez qu'en cas d'invitation l'année prochaine, vous accepterez probablement.
column4: Die Feier ist vorbei, es war ein fantastisches Fest. Als Ihr nach Hause aufbrecht, hofft Ihr, nächstes Jahr wiederkommen zu dürfen.
column6: El banquete ha terminado, pero fue fantástico. Mientras regresas a casa, piensas que probablemente volverás el año que viene si te invitan.

column2: I had a great time!
column3: J'ai passé un excellent moment !
column4: Es war eine großartige Zeit!

column4: Die Feier ist vorbei, doch einige unschöne Ereignisse verdarben die Stimmung. Als Ihr nach Hause aufbrecht, grübelt Ihr über die Höhen und Tiefen des Lebens.
column6: El banquete ha terminado, pero ciertos acontecimientos desafortunados han impedido que lo disfrutes plenamente. Mientras te diriges a casa reflexionas sobre los altibajos de la vida.

column2: Oh well.
column3: C'est la vie...
column4: Nun gut…
column6: En fin.

column2: A snake charmer from India is entertaining the guests at the feast. He plays a flute and sings in odd tones to various poisonous snakes that he has brought in a basket. The audience is held captivated by his skills as he seemingly controls the snakes with his voice and his music.
column3: Un charmeur de serpents offre un spectacle aux invités. Il joue de la flûte et chante une étrange mélopée à l'attention des serpents venimeux qu'il a apportés dans un panier. L'audience est captivée par son talent : il semble contrôler les serpents par le son de sa voix et par sa musique.
column4: Ein Schlangenbeschwörer unterhält die Gäste auf dem Fest. Er spielt seine Flöte und singt mit seltsamen Klängen zu einigen Giftschlangen, welche er in einem Korb mitbrachte. Die Zuhörer sind ganz eingenommen von seinen Fähigkeiten, da er scheinbar die Schlangen allein mit seiner Stimme und Musik kontrolliert.
column6: Un encantador de serpientes entretiene a los invitados del banquete. Toca la flauta y canta en extraños tonos a varias serpientes venenosas que ha traído en una cesta. La audiencia está atónita con sus habilidades pues parece controlar las serpientes con su voz y con su música.

column2: Fascinating!
column3: C'est fascinant !
column4: Faszinierend.
column6: ¡Fascinante!

column2: There is a silence among the revellers as the snake charmer works his magic with the snakes. But suddenly you hear a high shriek, and the snake charmer looks confused - it seems a large cobra has broken free and is slithering across the floor towards the guests!
column3: Les convives observent en silence le charmeur de serpents faire ses tours. Mais un cri perçant déchire l'air et le charmeur de serpents affiche une expression troublée. Il semble qu'un grand cobra ait pris quelques libertés, et le voilà qui traverse la salle en direction des invités !
column4: Die Feiernden schweigen, während der Schlangenbeschwörer seine Magie wirkt. Doch plötzlich hört Ihr einen lauten Schrei und der Beschwörer wirkt verwirrt - es scheint, dass eine große Kobra ausgebrochen ist und auf die Gäste zuschlängelt.
column6: Hay un silencio entre los asistentes cuando el encantador de serpientes realiza su magia con las serpientes. Pero de repente escuchas un alarido, el encantador de serpientes parece confuso - ¡una gran cobra está libre y rectando por el suelo hacia los invitados!

column2: Oh no!
column3: Oh non !
column4: Oh nein!
column6: ¡Oh, no!

column2: The escaped cobra disappears under the table. There are a few moments of silence, and then a shrill shriek. The cobra has slithered up into the lap of one of the guests, scaring the person half to death! The snake, then quickly disappears out through an open window.
column3: Le cobra en liberté disparaît sous la table. Après quelques moments de silence, un cri perçant retentit. Le cobra s'est glissé sur les genoux d'un invité, qui manque de mourir de peur ! Le serpent disparaît ensuite rapidement par une fenêtre ouverte.
column4: Die entkommene Kobra verschwindet unter dem Tisch. Einige Momente ist alles still, dann ertönt ein lauter Schrei. Die Kobra ist in den Schoß eines Gastes gekrochen und hat ihn zu Tode erschreckt. Dann verschwindet die Schlange schnell durch ein Fenster.
column6: La cobra fugada desaparece bajo la mesa. Hay unos momentos de silencio, y después un agudo chillido. ¡La cobra se ha arrastrado hasta el regazo de uno de los invitados, dándole un susto de muerte! La serpiente desaparece por una ventana abierta.

column4: Dieser Schlangenbeschwörer wird nicht wieder auftreten!
column6: No volveremos a contratar al encantador de serpientes.

column2: A snake charmer is entertaining the guests at the feast. He plays a flute and sings in odd tones to various poisonous snakes that he has brought in a basket. Then, suddenly you feel something cold and slithery moving in your lap...
column3: Un charmeur de serpents offre un spectacle aux invités. Il joue de la flûte et chante une étrange mélopée à l'attention des serpents venimeux qu'il a apportés dans un panier. Soudain, vous sentez quelque chose de froid et de glissant ramper sur vos genoux...
column4: Ein Schlangenbeschwörer unterhält die Gäste auf dem Fest. Er spielt seine Flöte und singt mit seltsamen Klängen zu einigen Giftschlangen, welche er in einem Korb mitbrachte. Plötzlich fühlt Ihr etwas kaltes und schlüpfriges in Eurem Schoß…
column6: Un encantador de serpientes entretiene a los invitados del banquete. Toca la flauta y canta en extraños tonos a varias serpientes venenosas que ha traído en una cesta. Entonces, de repente sientes algo frío reptando en tu regazo...

column3: Aaargh ! Un cobra !!
column4: Aaaaah! Eine Kobra!
column6: ¡Aaargh! ¡¡Una cobra!!

column2: The escaped cobra disappears under the table. There are a few moments of silence, and then a terrified scream. One of the guests is shaking in violent convulsions, with people nearby staring in shock as they realize the snake has bitten their neighbor. As the snake disappears out through an open window, the victim stops shaking and lies still, dead.
column3: Le cobra en liberté disparaît sous la table. Quelques instants de silence, puis un cri de terreur. Un des invités est en proie à de violentes convulsions. Les invités le fixent, figés de peur alors qu'ils comprennent que le serpent vient de mordre l'un des leurs. Alors que le serpent disparaît par une fenêtre ouverte, la victime cesse de trembler et s'effondre, sans vie.
column4: Die entkommene Kobra verschwindet unter dem Tisch. Einige Momente ist alles still, dann ertönt ein furchtbarer Schrei. Einer der Gäste zuckt unter Krämpfen, die Gäste daneben starren schockiert, als sie merken, dass die Schlange ihren Nachbar gebissen hat. Als die Schlange durch ein offenes Fenster entkommt, liegt das Opfer ruhig da... tot!
column6: La cobra fugada desaparece bajo la mesa. Hay unos momentos de silencio, y después un chillido de terror. Uno de los invitados se estremece en violentas convulsiones, con la gente petrificada mirando en cuanto se percatan de que la cobra ha mordido al vecino. Mientras la serpiente desaparece por una ventana abierta, la víctima deja de agitarse y yace muerta.

column3: Malheur !
column4: Oh weh!
column6: ¡Lástima!

column4: Die entkommene Schlange kriecht über den Boden. Die Gäste am Tisch wirken paralysiert, außer einer Person, welche schnell ihr Schwert zieht und mit gezieltem Schlag das Tier erschlägt.
column6: La cobra fugada se arrastra por el suelo. Los invitados de la mesa parecen paralizados, excepto una persona que rápidamente saca su espada y da un paso al frente, cortando al animal a la mitad rápidamente.

column2: Well done!
column3: Bravo !
column4: Gut gemacht!
column6: ¡Bien hecho!

column4: Ein Schlangenbeschwörer unterhält die Gäste des Festes, als plötzlich eine Kobra entkommt. Schnell zieht Ihr Euer Schwert, tretet vor und hackt mit flinkem Schlag das Tier in zwei Teile.
column6: Un encantador de serpientes entretiene a los invitados del banquete, ¡hasta que la cobra escapa! Rápidamente, sacas tu espada y das un paso al frente, contando al animal a la mitad.

column2: There is a murmur among the guests of the feast, as a shaman from the Azur enters to entertain you. With great flourish, he explains that the coming show will astound even the most cyncial spectator. He proceeds to put a small boy into a basket on the floor, wherafter he swiftly chops the basket into little pieces with a sword. When he removes the shreds of the basket, there is no sign of the boy, no blood, nothing...
column3: Alors qu'un mage entre pour vous divertir, un murmure se répand dans la foule. Avec grande emphase, il explique que le spectacle qui va suivre sera à même d'étonner même le plus cynique des spectateurs. Il place ensuite un petit garçon dans un panier puis, de son épée, taillade le panier et le met en pièces. Lorsqu'il soulève ce qui reste du panier, le petit garçon a disparu, pas une goutte de sang, rien du tout...
column4: Gemurmel erhebt sich, als ein Magier hervortritt um Euch zu unterhalten. Mit großen Gesten erklärt er, dass sein Auftritt selbst den zynischsten Beobachter verblüffen wird. Daraufhin steckt er einen kleinen Jungen in einen großen, auf dem Boden stehenden Korb - und beginnt, den Korb mit einem Schwert in Stücke zu hauen. Als er die Fetzen des Korbs schließlich entfernt, ist da kein Zeichen des Jungen, kein Blut, nichts...
column6: Hay un murmullo entre los invitados al banquete, mientras un mago entra a entretenerte. Con grandes florituras, explica que la próxima actuación dejará estupefacto hasta al más cínico. Comienza a introducir a un pequeño crío en una cesta en el suelo, entonces corta el cesto en trocitos con una espada. Retira los jirones de la cesta y no hay rastro del crío, ni sangre, nada...

column2: Amazing!
column3: Épatant !
column4: Wunderbar!
column6: ¡Increíble!

column2: Guards - arrest that man!
column3: Gardes ! Arrêtez cet homme !
column4: Wachen - nehmt ihn fest!
column6: ¡Guardias, arrestad a ese hombre!

column2: There is a murmur among the guests of the feast, as a Buddist wanderer enters to entertain you. With great flourish, he places three cups before you on the table. He places a ball under one cup, and then tells you to observe closely and tell you where the ball is after he finishes moving the cups. He then shifts the cups around with lightning speed, all the while prattling on and telling you to pay attention. He then asks you to pick a cup.
column3: Alors qu'un mage entre pour vous divertir, un murmure se répand dans la foule. Avec grande emphase, il place trois coupes devant vous sur la table. Il place ensuite une balle sous l'une des coupes et vous demande de prêter la plus grande attention : vous allez devoir deviner où se trouve la balle. Il déplace ensuite les coupes à la vitesse tout en déblatérant et en vous demandant de vous concentrer. Il vous demande alors de choisir une coupe.
column4: Gemurmel erhebt sich, als ein Magier hervortritt, um Euch zu unterhalten. Mit großen Gesten stellt er drei Becher auf den Tisch vor Euch. Er platziert eine kleine Kugel unter einem davon und fordert Euch auf, gut zu beobachten und ihm zu verraten, wo die Kugel nach dem Bewegen der Becher ist. Dann verschiebt er die Becher blitzartig hin und her, während er weiter plappert und aufzupassen ermahnt. Schließlich sollt Ihr einen Becher wählen.
column6: Hay un murmullo entre los invitados al banquete, mientras un mago entra a entretenerte. Con grandes florituras, coloca tres copas en la mesa. Coloca una bola bajo una copa, y te dice que observes detenidamente y digas dónde está la bola cuando termine de mover las copas. Entonces mueve las copas a la velocidad del rayo, todo mientras parlotea y te dice que prestes atención. Entonces te pide que elijas una copa.

column4: Der Magier schaut Euch mit wissendem Lächeln an und enthüllt die Kugel. Scheinbar habt Ihr den falschen Becher gewählt.
column6: El mago te mira con una sonrisa de superioridad y revela la bola. Parece que elegiste la que no era.

column4: Oh verdammt.
column6: Lo tengo.

column6: ¡Creo que haces trampas!

column3: Je vous ai vu tricher, sale escroc !
column4: Ich sah Euch mogeln, Ihr Gauner!
column6: ¡Te he visto hacer trampas, embaucador!

column2: Rope Trick

There is a murmur among the guests of the feast, as a mage enters to entertain you. With great flourish, he explains that you are about to see something amazing. He takes out a rope and starts playing a flute. The rope starts dancing by itself and rises up towards the ceiling. The magician beckons, and a small boy appears and starts climbing the rope. The audience gasps. After a minute, the boy climbs down, the magician stops playing and the rope falls down again.
column3: Alors qu'un mage entre pour vous divertir, un murmure se répand dans la foule. Avec grande emphase, il vous explique que vous allez être le témoin d'une chose extraordinaire. Il sort une corde et commence à jouer de la flûte. La corde se met à danser toute seule et monte ainsi jusqu'au plafond. Le magicien fait un signe de la tête. Un petit garçon s'avance et commence à monter le long de la corde. Les spectateurs retiennent leur souffle. Après une minute, l'enfant redescend. Le magicien arrête de jouer et la corde tombe au sol.
column4: Gemurmel erhebt sich, als ein Magier hervortritt, um Euch zu unterhalten. Mit großen Gesten erklärt er, dass Ihr gleich etwas Wunderbares sehen werdet. Er holt ein Seil hervor und beginnt auf der Flöte zu spielen. Das Seil beginnt zu tanzen und erhebt sich zur Decke. Der Magier klascht, ein kleiner Junge erscheint und erklettert das Seil. Das Publikum keucht. Nach einer Minute steigt der Junge wieder herab, der Magier beendet sein Flötenspiel und das Seil fällt wieder herab.

The priestess rejects a glass of Baekju. "Even I am seduced by the warm atmosphere your ancestors have made," she casts a look at her would-be-Mus, "But we serve nature first. It's creatures second." They file out in perfect order.
The Shinist speedily excuses herself and grabs an assistant's arm dragging her out the room. You wonder, as you swirl baekju in your cup, what happened?

You ask the Mu, why she doesn't she stay the night? She accepts gratefully. "We are currently researching the properties of crushed leopard member. We've made little progress today so I figure me and the girls will sleep on it."

The Mu bows, content at a well directed ritual. You offer to let her stay a night in the spare room but she dismisses the thought. "Fate has it a few of my girls haven't returned here yet. Experience suggests they may have found a room of their own." You exchange nods and she leaves.
The Mu bows, content at a well directed ritual. She accepts any extra coins and her ilk wander into the night.
What a woman!
column4: ne delet eta deyti

column2: The Mu invites your father to join you.
Well?
Father!
Please say something!
Speak to me!
Bow
Fall to your knees
Faaaaather!
Great lord.
Ancestors make him talk!
I don't believe he is here.
I can't see him.
I feel him.
Sigh
How will I know it is him?
I am having doubts.
Hail!
I have returned.
We meet again.
Grave can't seperate us.
Thank you priestess.
So much time has passed.
Welp.
What does he say?
I greet you.
It better sound like him.
I have missed you.
We miss you.
Get on one knee.
You brought me in, so will I.
I need guidance.
I need your voice.
Be my guide!
Just a minute
Don't leave me.
bring grandmother too!
Join us.
Just a friendly chat.
Monologue or dialogue?
Or never!
I love you.
Only you.
I tremble.
Your here right?
I still feel little.
Much has changed
Could it be?
Thank you for coming back.
Heavens wills it..
Bring light back into my world.
Why did you leave us?
I wait.
I can't wait.
Everyone leave us be!
Bodyguards leave us be!

Mireuk parted the world by putting four copper pillars between the earth and the sky. He destroyed each of the two suns and two moons and crafted the stars with the destroyed sun and moon. Mireuk discovered fire and water from a mouse after torturing it and made the first clothes from a kudzu vine.
The making of the world.
Seems legitimate
Thank you Mireuk!
He created humans from five golden bugs and five silver bugs. The bugs grew into humans
column3: the silver ones were women and the golden ones were male. These humans were very stupid and only after some time started looking like us. A man named Seokga discovered that eating fruit could make one intelligent. When Mireuk realized his pets had changed he raged and raged.

column2: I can relate
My ancestor was not a bug.
Old knowledge, best knowledge.

Seokga tricked Mireuk and captured him, intending him for worship. In three days, Mireuk fled his prison by transforming into a musk deer. In response, Seokga led three thousand priests to kill Mireuk. Seokga killed and ate the musk deer, and shared Mireuk's flesh with his priests. But two of the priests refused to eat the venison.
And?
Anticipation.
I feel hungry.

Seokga took out an axe and chopped their heads off, they turned into a large rock and a pine tree. Today we still eat flower pancakes, we know them as Hwajeon, in remembrance of the murdered priests. The End.
Bravo.
This actually happened.
Now I am even more hungry.

Habaek, the god of the Yellow River, had three daughters: Yuhwa , Hweonhwa, and Wuihwa. The eldest of his daughters, Yuhwa, was confronted by the Han god Hae Mo-su while she was bathing in a river, and eventually she married him without her father's permission. Outraged by the act, Yuhwa's father challenged Hae Mosu to a duel of metamorphosis..
Birth of Jumong
A Chinaman!?!
Very manly

Habaek transformed into a carp, a deer, and a quail, only to be caught by Hae Mo-su when he transformed into an otter, a wolf, and a hawk respectively. Defeated and recognizing Hae Mo-su's supremacy, Habaek consented to the marriage.
Yes you'll learn later
The proper way.
It happened.
Habaek was a little rusty.

However, after the official marriage ceremony was held, Yuhwa escaped Hae Mo-su's chariot before they could ascend to heaven and she returned to her father. Because his daughter's actions brought disgrace to him, Habaek had her lips stretched out and he exiled her to a stream in Dongbuyeo, condemning her to a mortal life.
Listen to your fathers.
Planning is important.

Yuhwa was later freed by fishermen, who brought her to the local wang, Geumwa. Her beauty and intelligence impressed Geumwa and he took her as a concubine. When she was exposed to sunlight, Yuhwa gave birth to an egg, which later turned into Jumong of the Go Dynasty. Upon her death, Lady Yuhwa was given the posthumous title of Queen Mother.
Historical facts.
Being a concubine is fine.
Who was the father?
The Tiger and the Villager.

One day a tiger fell down a hole and in its misery begged a passer-by to help him up. Afterwards the tiger pinned him down and prepared to eat the man. The villager said he was from Gang-Wang-Dong, where many mountains peak, he only wanted to serve the Tiger. The tiger replied that he hated humans because they hunted tigers. The man in desperation turned to a passing cow for confirmation that humanity was virtuous.
Go on ...
I'm too old for this trife.
In my story I pounced on the tiger.

The tiger liked games, it made his kill so much more interesting, so he agreed to ask the cow. The glum looking cow yawned. “Man makes me work hard in the field, then, when I’m too old to work, they make food and shoes out of me. Tiger, go ahead and eat him.” The man yelped and looking into the distance saw a rabbit approaching. "Ask her!" He pointed.
That would never work.
Tickle a child.
Think about statecraft improvements.
Good thing I'm Buddhist.

This is your last chance juicy young man.” Warned the tiger cleaning its paws. The villager anxiously explained the situation to the little brown rabbit. The rabbit had a little think then said. “Before I make my decision, I need to see exactly what happened.” When they arrived at the deep pit, the rabbit said, “Now, show me exactly where you were when this young man passed by.” The hungry tiger, impatient for lunch, hopped into the pit. “Welp, I was in this deep, dirty hole and I started roaring because I was stuck. I was stuck, in this deep, deep hole ... I’m stuck! NO!” The tiger began roaring with rage. The man thanked the rabbit and the two parted.
That clever rabbit.
Nobody could be that stupid.
Old but good.
Lord Al'Chon.
Once during the reign of Queen Chindok of Silla, Lords Al'chon, Imjong, Suljong, Horim, Yomjang and Kim Yusin gathered at Oji Rock on South Mountain to deliberate affairs of state..
High altitudes for high people
Continue.
Silly Silla.
Greatest ruler of Silla.

Thereupon a huge tiger ran out into the meeting place. The lords all rose up in fright, save Lord Alch'on who laughed and calmly went on with the discussion while seizing the tiger by the tail and dashing it to death. His white robes bloodened, somehow he lost the discussion.
That would never work.
Tickle a child.
What a man.
Lord Alchon led the country by his might, being the Queens muscle, but it was the majesty of Commander Kim Yusin that the others most esteemed.
I need a Kim Yusin.
She probably had an affair.
Is there a moral?
The Stupid Slave.
Earlier, when building pavilions, each slave worker brought his own food. One worker was too poor even to do that, so the other workers shared with a him a spoonful of their own food.
Go on.
Slaves. No hygine
Yes. Even today.

One day his wife came with food and said, "Please ask your friends to come and share it with you." The worker said, "our family is poor. How did you prepare food? Did you have intimate relations with another man to get it, or did you steal it?"
Ouch.
Children. Bedtime.
I can forgive stealing.

His wife replied, "My face is too ugly for me to be intimate with anyone, and I am too stupid to know how to steal. I simply cut my hair and sold it." Then she showed her head. The worker sobbed and could not eat.
Slaves are stupid.
Let slaves slave.
What a touching story.
Glorious leader will fix this!
The Indian Princess.

One day King Suro of the Kaya Union was resting on the beach. He aspied a vessel sailing north and by its design it was foreign. He boarded a ship and sailed to the ship. On it he saw a maiden with brown skin. He fell in love.
Then?
Children they exist.
Silla pillaged Kaya.

He launched a craft and demanded she dock at Kaya. "As until now I have never met you, how can I dare frivolously follow you?", She replied sailing to the cold lands. He rowed back and followed her at a distance. One night she landed on an island and he went to her tent.
Women
Men.
Love does strange things.

I am a princess of Ayodhya, She said, "my name is Hwangok. I am sixteen years old. In May, when I was still in my home country, my parents, the wang and Queen, said to me, "Last night in a dream we together saw the Heavenly Emperor, who said to us, "A man called Suro is the founding King of Kaya and was sent by heaven. I was sent to be his spouse."
Maybe Thailand?
Yes that's far away.
I need one.

Since I was born I have foreseen that a princess would come from a distant land. Even though my officals previously requested that I marry a queen, I did not heed them. And now that you, a princess, have come to me on your own, I am indeed extremely fortunate. Thereafter, they were married and passed two nights and a day together.
Beautiful.
She gave us Buddhism.
We have words in common.
Princess Seondeok.
King Jinpyeong of Silla had three daughters: Sunhwa was passionate, the other ______ was considerate and Seondeok waited before everyone stopped speaking to speak.
Yee.
Sad situation to be in.
His daughters were all whores.

One day her father received a box of peony seeds from the Emperor Taizong of Tang accompanied by a painting of what the flowers looked like. Looking at the picture, the young Seondeok remarked that while the flower was pretty it was a shame that it did not smell. "If it did, there would be butterflies and bees around the flower in the painting."
Perceptive.
You can't teach intelligence.
And?.

Her observation about the peonies' lack of scent proved correct — just one of many illustrations of her intellect and hence of her ability to rule. She eventually became Silla's second queen and made Silla the greatest of the 3 kingdoms.
Great story.
Define: great.
This is why Silla is the greatest.
Kim Yusin.

Kim Yusin was gifted from birth with the essense of the sun, the moon and the five stars, he bore on his back the pattern of the seven stars, and miraculous happenings befell him. At the age of eighteen he mastered swordscraft and joined the hwarang of Silla.
Chef bring dopoki.
There are more than seven stars.

His brother in arms Paeksok one day offered to spy on Gogoreyo with him. They strode out one night and tired, rested on a hill. Two girls appeared and followed Kim. When they arrived at Youngchon, a third girl appeared and Kim spoke happily with the girls. The girls gave him fruit and he spoke without reserve.
Yee
What kind of fruit?
Silly Sillaman.

They said, "We already know all that you have told us. Please leave Paeksok behind and follow us to the forest, we have a warning." Kim followed the girls, whereupon they turned into spirits. "We are the guardian spirits of the three mountains. We came to warn you that you are being lured by an enemy spy to trap you here.
Yee.
Naerim, Hyollye and Korhwa.
Peak times.

Kim returned to Paeksok and they went to the capital. There he was arrested, bounded and interrogated. Paeksok confessed that Kim Yusin was believed the recarnation of heretic Ch'unam, put to death by the Queen of Koguryo. The queen had placed a mouse in a box and asked Ch'unam what was inside. "Your answer is wrong, and you shall die".
Traitor.
Recarnation is false.
You call this law?

Ch'unam said it appeared to be one but there were eight rats in the box. After his death the rat's belly was slit open, it was found to contain seven unborn young. That night the wang dreamt Ch'unam entered Kim Yusin's mother's breast. Kim Yusin beheaded Paeksok and offered sacrifices to the three guardian spirits. Then he destroyed Gogoreyo.".
Thank you grandmother.
Kim Yusin, rigged to win.
I have the following ingredients Dehwa! She says in a sing song voice.
I need your purple clove infusion.
I need antler medicine for relationship issues.
Black hoof mushroom tea for me.
Treat that plant oil.
Following [Root.job_spymaster.GetFirstName] she goes to the storeroom. Her assistants keep their heads down as she returns and presents a warm-mixture, it is a green paste.
Down it goes.
She asks her assistant for the sachel of crushed muskdeer antlers. They smile knowingly as their holy mother gives you the grainy power. She advices you to take it thrice a day but not mixed in tea.
Thank you.
Your trainee, over there, is curing me already.

[Root.job_spymaster.GetFirstName] says some words to the Mu who snaps out her trace. The procession bow and hurry their way for the gate. You watch from the balcony, [Root.job_spymaster.GetFirstName] whispers that the one you liked will be ready later.
Nice.
That was not my intention.

You are rejecting a slave petition when she comes through the door. She looks repulsed at your face but turns off the lights and climbs into the bed. After a pleasant evening you wake up and she is nowhere to be found.
You are dropping plans to tax Shinist practitioners when the assistant enters. She looks flushed and you can't make her seem relaxed. You ask what she wants and she asks to leave. You let her leave.

You plan before she arrives. She answers question after question under interogation. You inform her based on her answers she qualifies as a Court Mu but would need to do what [Root.Father.GetFirstName]'s female councilers did to earn their position. She foolishly accepts and bares her non-metaphysical merits.

The trainee takes too long to come and you borrow a lady-in-waiting for some bodily suprise. The maiden arrives and without losing a step expresses her satisfaction the muskdeer antler remedy worked. She keeps her head down until you finish and you send both away.

You read the saga of Baekje volume 2 to pass the time. When she comes in she looks very embarassed, [From.GetTitledFirstName] I can't be your consort because of a purity ritual tomorrow. I hope you understand? You realize the consequences and let her go.

She comes in your chamber and gazes at your strong arms. You approach her and lift her up whispering sweet nothings. After feeling comfortable being in the air, she breathes she was secretly attracted to you. You unfold her bun and passionately lock lips. Afterwards, she tells you, "you'll see me again if the antlers work".

The Mu-to-be enters your room flustered. She takes a look at you then blushes. You say you are hers for the night and she quietly undresses. Despite the conceit you can tell you made her dreams come true for a night.

The Mu-to-be enters your room. "Take off your clothes!", you order. She looks confused but starts peeling them off. "Ha!", you laugh. She flares into a terrible rage, "Your bad! Everyone knows you favour men. You didn't have to trick me!". She throws on her clothes and leaves with a huff.

You wait excited for the trainee to enter. She comes in looking unsure. "Perhaps you have memorized the story of the Princess and the horse?", you ask. She looks at you then runs away screaming. Despite your guards efforts, she somehow turns into a giant silkworm and slithers over the walls.

When she comes you happen to be with [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] talking spirtual matters. You invite her to join the debate and agree with everything she says. "We are so akin, it's heavenly." You exclaim. After much baekju you tell her you are in love. She whispers, "I don't let first night!". You reply, "We are in love right?"
You wait eagerly as she comes in the door. She takes one look at you and laughs. "Who do you think you are? The wang?" You tell the guards to give her a caning and take her to her mother Priestess.

The trainee quietly enters the room and bows. You are in the middle of examining preliminary sketches for a Shinist temple. She makes her way to the bedside and unties her long hair. You finish your stamping before taking off your robes and test if the muskdeer remedy dependably works.

You wait eagerly as she comes in the door. She takes one look at you and laughs. "Who do you think you are? The son of heaven?" You tell the guards to strip her naked and take her to her mother Priestess.

You cast your eyes as the door opens. She skips in like a fox and slides to your ears. "I heard you are a seducer." You nod and breath on her neck. She stirs and wraps her arms around you. Together entwined you stir half the palace up.

You cast your eyes as the door opens. She shuffles in and says she has a message from her superior. "I aint to be consorting with low level officals." You threaten to execute her entire magical kin and hysterically she offers to do anything to save them. You demand crushed dragon bone and she returns after a few hours with a sachel.
A good thing done.

You wait for her to arrive but instead [Root.GetChancellorName] comes in with an important letter. It is from the Mu who explains it is best for your minor family to not be involved in scandal. You order her and her girls banned from your territory.

You wait for her to arrive but instead [Root.job_spymaster.GetFirstName] comes in with an grave news. His spies have lost her and rumours have it they metamorphed into three legged birds and flew away.

You wait for her to arrive but instead the Mu comes in. Cheol Hae is sick tonight so I have taken her place. She starts to undress and you hurriedly keep her clothes on and escort her personally out the holding.

You are rejecting a slave petition when she comes through the door. But it isn't the same girl but a diseased tart you know is desperate for business. She keeps her eyes low as you ask her to their location, she replies "somewhere in the forest".
Those good for nothing women!

[Root.job_spymaster.GetFirstName] whispers some words to the Mu who snaps out her trace. The procession bow and hurry their way for the gate. You watch from the balcony, [Root.job_spymaster.GetFirstName] whispers that the one you liked will be ready later.
Nice.

[Root.job_spymaster.GetFirstName] keeps an eye on her as she adds ingredient after ingredient into a bowl. She asks for hot water and it is brought. She presents you with a cup of tea, refusing to give eye contact. You drink the worst mixture you've ever tasted.
Ew!

After a good rest you feel it is right to visit the Mu before she leaves town. You thank her and her young ladies for their expertise. You write them a permit to use your hunting retreats as guest houses, in case the weather catches up to them.
Peace be with them!

[From.GetTitledFirstName] please go to your room and wait for me there. You go to your room, strip of your clothes and lie on your stomach. She enters and begins applying plant oil to your naked flesh. Her hands feel shocking at first, but then seem like part of your body. She finishes by scraping off old skin with bark.
I feel refreshed
I don't feel any different.

You've been asking lately about far, far away lands. You visit the merchants awfuly regularly and are suprised a young girl like yourself knows about the outside world. Surely you were meant for a different setting than this dreary place.
You will go to papa!
Your [From.GetSonDaughter] has a demand. Your [From.GetSonDaughter] wants to be married as far away from the family has possible, it order to spread our religion and culture.
That is roughly how it works.
I never want to see you again too.
How about Ayodhya?
Yee that would be far enough. [From.GetSheHeCap] bows and leaves the room.
Strange child.
[From.GetSheHeCap] looks suprised and then gets on her knees: I am sorry for my dreams I will try to grow up.
I'll support you through them.
I think you should.

Your [From.GetSonDaughter] [From.GetFirstName] has told you of [From.GetSheHeCap] inability to marry. [From.GetSheHeCap] has been infested with seven ghosts they have agreed to rip [From.GetHerHis] into seven pieces if [From.GetSheHeCap] marries.
Spirits! [From.GetSheHeCap] isn't getting any treats. Leave!
Well I suppose I can send for the Mu to negotiate with them.
I promise you won't have to marry anyone you don't want to.
This reminds me of the Seongjugut.

[Root.GetLordSpiritualName], [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] has arrived. After kneeling on the carpet the [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] begins addressing the ghosts. After talking to them, occasionally offering translation for your benefit, [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName]] takes you to the corner and whispers. "It's not good. It is a hostage situation."
A hostage!
I suppose they want some phantom goods too.
Give a long hard look to your child.

After [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] finishes briefing you on possesion. You order [Root.GetTreasurerName] [Root.job_treasurer.GetTitledFirstName] to bring fine silks, jade figures and a cart of fine rice to the location, interpreted as the lands of the underworld where Jital Buin sprang from. You see [From.GetFirstName] is getting pale.
And hurry!.
I'm going to get military police too!.
The Mu returns and says the spirits have been placided. They might return so your [From.GetSonDaughter] should bang a drum several times before going to bed.
Back to normal.

[Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] has been caught trying to bargain with criminals. You never thought this possible, but you order [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] into the dungeons until the crime is confessed.
Stranger than fiction.
We all make mistakes.
The Mu warns you that angry spirits being ancestors enjoy the same tastes as the mortal.
I think I know an easy way to flip this hostage situation.
You have five seconds to get out of my face.
I see let us proceed with your plan.

[Root.GetLordSpiritualName], [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] arrives. After kneeling on the carpet the [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] begins addressing the ghosts. After a lively discussion [Root.GetLordSpiritualName] states the ghouls refuse to let your [From.GetSonDaughter] wed.
I suppose that is that.
Please expound our best option.

[Root.GetLordSpiritualName] [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] explains that as described in the Seongjugut the only treatment would be for [From.GetSonDaughter] to eat prisioner food while living in a burrow encircled by a ring of dog manure for three years.
Let it be done.
I prefer possession.
Dear [Root.GetFatherMotherCap], I awoke this morning and six of the ghosts had left, the sole phantom tells me I am free to do what I will. It is gone too. I thank Jamung for this recent development

Dear [Root.GetFatherMotherCap], after speaking to [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName] I realized these phantoms were strains from all homework I have been doing. Has anything like this ever happened to thou?
Dear [Root.GetFatherMotherCap], I thank you for addressing my problem so seriously. I feel as light as a feather now and think the ghosts have liberated me out of pity.

Dear [Root.GetFatherMotherCap], me and the spirits have parted our ways after they revealed their weakness was pine flavoured rice cakes. I guzzled twelve and they screamed and thudded on our walls leaving dents. Please come see.

Dear [Root.GetFatherMotherCap], after sacrificing my pet rat Hong and consulting the divine trinity I was enlightened to the fact the holy spirits shouldn't, really, impede my upcoming marriage. Isn't that heavenly!
OK
Dear [Root.GetFatherMotherCap] I accept this fate in order to cure myself of the hateful seven. I just ask to be provided incense
OK
Dear [Root.GetFatherMotherCap] I appologize sincerely for my actions in recent days. Please kill me.
OK

After four months living in a burrow your child has returned and claims the spirits have left. [From.GetSheHeCap] suggests it was the combined state of Seongjushin and Teojushin, god and goddess of house and earth, that opened the spirits to the possiblity of marriage. [From.GetSheHeCap] thanks [Root.Guardian.GetTitledFirstName] for providing books.
I recogn you need a bath

It is a miserable life as [Root.job_spiritual.GetTitledFirstName], spreading the factual faith amongst the peasants on a stringy budget amid danger. When your liege had a problem with his brat you decided to reward yourself by fooling them. Little did you know you would be caught.
Blag your way out of prision

After being swept around the country, you welcomed the summon of your liege to expell spirits from his child. You had one look at the poor thing and realized it was a lie. You decided to teach a lesson and demanded a large - fee - for your work. You ordered your men to stand by and the plan worked flawlessly.
It is only fair.
Your son has informed you of his intentions to become an architect.
This is a very good trade that could benefit the country!
At the expense of military training?.
And build the sky-palace I suppose?.
Your daughter has informed you of her intentions to marry a man of Baekje.
How about a Mongolian?
The house of Baekje is gone dear.
You will definately marry your strong, handsome Jang.
You can't be like Princess Sunhwa until you become talented.
Your son wants to marry a beautiful princess of Silla.
Sillaphilia is forbidden!
First you have to impress her.
A song is spreading around _______'s children suggesting that your [From.GetSonDaughter], [From.GetFirstName], has been seeing __________ and giving love.
This is outrageous!
Wait I know this tale. They are just poking fun at them.
At least he is nobility.
Your [From.GetFirstName] has overworked herself and fallen stressed. When you meet her by the bedside she claims she was trying to be like Makmak Buin who created a thousand tools in one day.
Makmak Buin was a commoner. Here let me gift you this rabbit.
It is just a silly story. Forget all about it.
A woman could never make that many tools anyhow.
Keep trying!
Your [GetFromRelation], [From.GetFirstName], has contacted you. [From.GetSheHeCap] had a nightmare that they turned into a unmarried Mongdal and haunted you after they died.
Don't worry bad dreams are only dreams. It's part of the time you were born.
I'll find you someone nice so we can sleep nice.
At least not a Mongol!
Your [GetFromRelation], [From.GetFirstName], has contacted you. [From.GetSheHeCap] had a nightmare that they turned into a unmarried Songaxi and haunted you after they died.
Don't worry bad dreams are only dreams. It's just part of the time you were born.
I'll find you someone nice so we can sleep nice.
It could be worse!

You just awoke [GetFromRelation] [From.GetFirstName] visited you by your bedside. [From.GetSheHeCap] wailed and wailed hitting you with their fists. Then [From.GetSheHeCap] grabbed you and tried to pull you out the window.
Bad dreams are only dreams. It's just part of the time you were born..
I'll repent. I will make a shrine for [GetFromRelation]
I will write a diary about this!
Dear [Root.Guardian.GetTitledFirstName] I have decided I want to join the Hwarang and do good service for the country. Please accept this arrangement and I'll be forever grateful.
Of course my boy!
It is too dangerous, what would your mother think?
How about you become my personal aide?
It is reported [From.GetFirstName] has healed [From.From.GetFirstName]. His skills are being put to good use
Really!
It is reported [From.GetFirstName] has helped the village of Son-Chu. He helped reclaim unused land by locating earthworms at limestone deposits and bringing them enmasse to the infertile land.
Really!
Raise the taxes then.
It is reported [From.GetFirstName] has earned merit in bringing to heel Buddhists in the youth corps. He showed them the medical properties of Antlers and how the lives saved outweighed recarnation.
Really!

It is reported [From.GetFirstName] has earned fame in bringing to heel those pagans in the youth corps. He proved that meditation could lower the heart beat to inaudiable, shattering their superstitious facts.
Really!
It is reported [From.GetFirstName] has beat up robbers preying on travelers during Chuseok. Him and his closest friends covered a twenty mile highway and earned much thanks.
So that is why he disappeared.
It is reported [From.GetFirstName] has uncovered corrupt Mu witch doctors in your demesne who have robbed peasants blind. Him and his friend Aja brought these hounds to justice.
Really!
Tell him to bring the gold to me.
I want to meet this Aja-nim.

It is reported [From.GetFirstName] has broken up gangs of boys who dig up ancestorial graves. His closest friends tickled the boys with their feathers until they gave up their ringleader. The swine is in your jail right now.
Really!
That is a form of torture. Bring him to me.

It is reported [From.GetFirstName] has quelled the opposition to your rule. He marched around the countryside handing out Hangwa to children and helping elderly mothers chop wood. He only praised your name.
Really!
I'll send him some money.
Ginseng would make the perfect gift.

It is rumoured Youth Captain [From.GetFirstName] has earned himself many female followers on part of his good looks. They vary in age and often carry pictures of him. The oldest have been rumoured to share his quarters.
Silly women
Utter scandal
Ginseng would make the perfect gift.
It is rumoured [From.GetFirstName] has earned himself many female followers on part of his prestige. They pay respects to his friends only to get closer to him.
Silly women!

The Magic Drum

The building your sitting in used wood.

Radient.

Persist ...

I feel refreshed.
You dance like your on fire. The music stops and you introduce yourself to your partners parents. They take one look at you and sweep their doeful daughter away.
Arg!.
Your partner thanks you for having faith in them.

Preparation ...
Bye!
You stumble home with your bodyguards, they keep their heads down as you twirl and dance.
Magical.
After the dance. Your partner asks for a kiss, they think it is only fair because they saved the [Root.GetTitle]'s reputation.
In your dreams.
Tell him your taken.
Give him a kiss on the cheek.
You stumble home, occasionally leaning on your bodyguards, the drink alone can't keep at bay the thought that now: Everyone knows your a crummy dancer.
I am the greatest.

You've mastered the hundred branches of knowledge.
Rarer than dry, polished rice.
Teach me.

Filthy outcasts tricked me!.
Could you bring some choice meat for the barbeque?.

Cannot wait.
